data.text:
@AschConformity_ @PopulismUpdates I owe my existance to the fact that my 18 year old grand father decided to leave Germany on Feb 2nd 1933.

There is no such thing as being over prepared.

@AschConformity_ @PopulismUpdates Trump, either has been restricted by US institutions or has decided against going all in authoritarian, cause his authoritarian tendencies have been isolated mostly to his rethoric.

@AschConformity_ @PopulismUpdates You absolutely should take them seriously.  But you shouldnt automatically expect the worst case scenario. You should probably prepare for a worst case scenario though.
@Les_Worse @PopulismUpdates i'd say the guy who wants to fuck over the Amazon Rainforest - and probably has no obstacles preventing him from accomplishing that - is an automatic #1 contender
@AschConformity_ @PopulismUpdates This is def not an argument to support Bolsonaro, just trying to explain situation is very complex and that the current level of uncertainty is astronomically high

@AschConformity_ @PopulismUpdates In Argentina we have Bagliani's Theroem that states: "The closer one political force gets to power the more reasonable their policies become".

What Bolsonaro should we trust the one that said he would kill a gay son or the one that said he wants to let them leave peacefully?

@PopulismUpdates The possibility of him becoming Duterte^10 is there and it is (as it should) unbelievably scary.

But assuming worst possible scenario is the most likely to happen is imho not realistic.

@PopulismUpdates A literal fascist won the Presidential election for a country with a massive population where most of the political power is concentrated in the office of the Presidency. Aside from the American 2018 midterm elections, Brazil's 2018 election is the biggest event of this year.
@MarianoMarx_ it's also about how he won though, and the implications that has for the rest of the world
@PopulismUpdates I mean if the criteria is “which individual had the most impact on the world” then 9/10 times it should be the US President no matter who’s in office

@PopulismUpdates The thing is, no one can really know what to expect from Bolsonaro. Yes, he has said outrageous things both as a congressman and candidate.

But he has also have a wide array of positions during his political life, he could go Duterte^10 or be a more socially conservative Piñera.
@Les_Worse i feel like they wouldnt give it to him again unless he wins re-election, although you're not wrong
the world seriously needs to know about this, biggest geopolitical event since Trump, and bigger than Brexit imo
